definitions.definition: the faculty or state of being able to see.
synonyms: perspective "her vision was blurred by tears"

definitions.definition: the ability to think about or plan the future with imagination or wisdom.
examples: the organization had lost its vision and direction

definitions.definition: a mental image of what the future will or could be like.
the images seen on a television screen.
an experience of seeing someone or something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition.
examples: the idea came to him in a vision
synonyms: shade "the psychic was troubled by visions of the dead"

definitions.definition: a vivid mental image, especially a fanciful one of the future.
a person or sight of unusual beauty.
examples: beautiful sight, feast for the eyes, pleasure to behold, delight, dream, beauty, picture, joy, marvel; Moreinformalsight for sore eyes, stunner, knockout, looker, eye-catcher, peach "Melissa was a vision in lilac"Moresight for sore eyes, stunner, knockout, looker, eye-catcher, peach Melissa was a vision in lilac
